wikipedia_page.main: Rear Admiral David Arthur Dunbar-Nasmith  (21 February 1921 – 15 September 1997) was a former Royal Navy officer who became Naval Secretary.

response: In 1920 he married Beatrix Justina Dunbar-Dunbar-Rivers; they had two sons (Rear-Admiral David Dunbar-Nasmith and the architect Professor Sir James Dunbar-Nasmith) and a daughter.

link_mentions.page: Gentleman Usher of the Green Rod
response: *1979–1997: Rear Admiral David Dunbar-Nasmith CB DSC (1921–1997)

He was born in Totnes, Devon,England & Wales, Civil Registration Birth Index, 1916-2007 the son of Admiral Sir Martin Dunbar-Nasmith,  (1883–1965) and Beatrix Justina Dunbar-Dunbar-Rivers . His elder brother was Rear-Admiral David Dunbar-Nasmith,  (1921–1997). He was educated at Lockers Park School, Winchester College and Trinity College, Cambridge.
Between 1954 and 1956 she was commanded by Lieutenant Commander David Dunbar-Nasmith.

On the death of Sir John A. C. Forbes in 2000, the baronetcy was inherited by a kinsman, Andrew Iain Ochoncar Forbes (1945–2017), the only son of Lieutenant Colonel Patrick Walter Forbes OBE, elder son of Lieutenant Colonel James Ochoncar Forbes, younger son of James Ochoncar Forbes, younger brother of the 8th baronet and 17th Lord Semphill.Charles Kidd, Christine Shaw, Debrett's Peerage & Baronetage 2008 (2007), p. B-356 However, the baronetcy is on the dormant list of the Standing Council of the Baronetage, as the 13th baronet has not yet established his claim to the title. In 1984 the 13th baronet married Jane Elizabeth Dunbar-Nasmith, a daughter of Rear-Admiral David Dunbar-Nasmith, and they had two sons, James and David Forbes, and two daughters, Isabel and Anna Elizabeth Abercrombie Forbes.
